marketNews.title: Indonesian Economy +4.87% YoY in 1Q25, Weakest Since 3Q21
marketNews.content: BPS noted that Indonesia's economic growth only reached +4.87% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: +5.11% YoY, 4Q24: +5.02% YoY), below the consensus expectation which projected +4.91% YoY, marking the weakest economic growth since 3Q21. This realization is lower than the government's 2025 target of +5.2% YoY, although it remains within Bank Indonesia's target range aspiring for growth around +4.7-5.5% YoY.Quarterly, Indonesia's economic growth contracted by -0.98% QoQ (vs. 1Q24: -0.83% QoQ), also lower than the consensus expectation of -0.89% QoQ.From the expenditure side, the slowdown in annual Indonesian economic growth was influenced by weakening household consumption (+4.89% YoY vs. 1Q24: +4.91% YoY) and a decrease in government consumption (-1.42% YoY vs. 1Q24: +19.9% YoY), amidst shifts in Lebaran seasonality, incentives for the public, and government budget efficiency.The Head of BPS, Amalia Adininggar Widyasanti, attributed the weakening household consumption and the decrease in government consumption to the high-base effect from the 2024 election. Amalia also stated that the impact of the 2025 State Budget efficiency instructed by President Prabowo Subianto in January 2025 on government consumption will be more visible in 2Q25.Besides household and government consumption, gross fixed capital formation (GFCF) also weakened (+2.12% YoY, vs. 1Q24: +3.78% YoY) due to investors' wait and see attitude towards global economic developments.Indonesia's annual economic growth in 1Q25 was more driven by net exports with a contribution of 0.83 percentage point (vs. 1Q24: 0.06 percentage point) and other variables with a contribution of 0.86 percentage point (vs. 1Q24: 0.16 percentage point).Based on the business field, the agriculture sector (+10.52% YoY vs. 1Q24: -3.54% YoY) became the largest contributor to economic growth in 1Q25 with a contribution reaching 1.11 percentage point (vs. 4Q24: 0.07 percentage point, 1Q24: -0.41 percentage point), supported by the harvest of rice and corn crops.Spatially, weak economic growth was restrained by the Maluku and Papua region (+1.69% YoY), Bali and Nusa Tenggara (+3.12% YoY), Kalimantan (+4.32% YoY), and Sumatra (+4.85% YoY). Meanwhile, the Sulawesi and Java regions managed to record higher growth compared to national economic growth, reaching +6.4% YoY and +4.99% YoY, respectively.In a separate occasion, the Minister of National Development Planning, Rachmat Pambudy, said on Monday (5/5) that the government is targeting economic growth around +5.8-6.3% YoY during 2026.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although Indonesian economic growth has the potential to accelerate in 2H25 along with increased government spending and interest rate cuts, the development of the trade war provides uncertainty regarding future growth realizations. Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, stated that the 32% tariff from the US has the potential to cut Indonesia's economic growth by about 0.3-0.5 percentage point. Previously, the World Bank and IMF had cut Indonesia's economic growth outlook for 2025 from +5.1% YoY to +4.7% YoY, respectively.

marketNews.title: What else is hot that you need to know...
marketNews.content: The consensus of economists surveyed by Bloomberg expects Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates 2 more times down to the 5.25% level by the end of 2025. Economists' consensus expects Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates by 25 bps at the end of 2Q25 and another 25 bps in 3Q25. Besides interest rates, the consensus of economists expects the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia to reach 1.8% YoY in 2Q25 and 2% YoY throughout 2025, lower than previous expectations of 1.9% YoY and 2.1% YoY, respectively.BPS noted that the open unemployment rate in Indonesia in February 2025 decreased by -0.06 percentage point to 4.76%. This result was influenced by the labor force participation rate rising +0.80 percentage point compared to February 2024, with the number of employed persons growing by 3.67 million people to 153.05 million people and the number of employed residents increasing by 3.59 million people to 145.77 million people.BPS noted that the average labor wage in February 2025 grew +1.78% YoY from 3.04 million rupiah to 3.09 million rupiah.As many as 8 OPEC+ member countries on Saturday (3/5) agreed to increase oil production by 411,000 barrels per day starting from June 2025. With this decision, the total OPEC+ production increase to be implemented in April, May, and June 2025 reached 960,000 barrels per day or equivalent to 44% of the total production cut of 2.2 million barrels per day previously carried out by OPEC+. Responding to this news, WTI crude oil futures for the June 2025 contract fell -3.6% to the level of 56.19 US dollars per barrel on Monday (5/5) morning.Berkshire Hathaway CEO (NYSE: BRK-A), Warren Buffett, resigned from his position at the end of 2025, ending his 60-year leadership era. Buffett's position will be replaced by Vice Chairman, Greg Abel.Bloomberg reported that Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) has grounded at least 15 aircraft units due to difficulties in making maintenance payments, indicating that the airline's revival plan might be faltering. Most of the planes whose operations were halted came from the PT Citilink unit, according to Bloomberg sources. Bloomberg sources also mentioned that some of GIAA's suppliers requested advance payments for spare parts and labor due to concerns over the company's financial situation. GIAA representatives have not commented on this issue. Based on the latest data from aviation fleet trackers, Cirium, GIAA has 66 aircraft units in operation and 14 units in storage.Darma Henwa (DEWA) shareholders, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold ~493 million DEWA shares at a price of 75 rupiah per share on April 29, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~37 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara's ownership in DEWA decreased from 24.81% to 23.59%.The controller and President Commissioner of Tripar Multivision Plus (RAAM), Ram Jethmal Punjabi, bought ~5.2 million RAAM shares at an average price of 301 rupiah per share on April 24 and 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Ram Jethmal Punjabi's direct ownership in RAAM increased from 70.946% to 71.022%.The controller and President Director of Sarana Mitra Luas (SMIL), Hadi Suhermin, bought 20 million SMIL shares at a price of 256 rupiah per share on May 2, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~5.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hadi Suhermin's direct ownership in SMIL increased from 50.32% to 50.55%.Acset Indonusa (ACST) shareholders on Friday (2/5) approved the plan for a private placement of up to 5 billion new shares with an estimated exercise price of 100 rupiah per share and a dilution effect of up to 28%. The funds raised from this corporate action are intended to strengthen the capital structure and improve the company's financial condition, which currently still records negative equity. The investor who will absorb this private placement is the company's controller, PT Karya Supra Perkasa.

marketNews.title: Is Indonesian Economy in Good Condition?
marketNews.content: "Although it is not yet heading towards a crisis, this is a signal that domestic demand is starting to be pressured, and sentiment is moving towards cautious instead of optimistic."

tickerNews.title: TPIA Subsidiary Reportedly Eyes Up to IDR 2.4 Trillion in IPO Funds
tickerNews.content: Bisnis Indonesia reported that Chandra Asri Pacific's subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, plans to conduct an IPO for up to ~12.5 billion shares with a price range of 170-190 rupiah per share. The maximum proceeds from this corporate action reach approximately 2.4 trillion rupiah. Bisnis Indonesia explained that their report is based on the preliminary prospectus of PT Chandra Daya Investasi which they obtained. In February 2025, TPIA said that PT Chandra Daya Investasi was considering an IPO on the BEI.

tickerNews.title: Bukit Asam Eyes USD 3.1 Billion Investment for Coal Gasification Project with PGAS
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bukit Asam, Arsal Ismail, said on Monday (5/5) that the company is studying plans to invest 3.1 billion US dollars in a coal gasification project to produce synthetic natural gas. This project, which will be carried out together with Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS), will convert 8.4 million tons of PTBA's coal with a calorific value of 3,700 GAR into 240 BBTUD of gas. The plan is for the plant for this project to be built by a joint venture between PTBA, PGAS, and a third party as the technology provider. However, Arsal did not specify the technology provider.

tickerNews.title: SIDO to Distribute Final Dividend for 2024 Book Year
tickerNews.content: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul will distribute a final dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 630 billion rupiah or 21 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 3.9% as of Monday (5/5). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is May 14, 2025, with payment on May 26, 2025. Previously, SIDO distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 540 billion rupiah or 18 rupiah per share in November 2024, making the total dividend for the 2024 fiscal year reach approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah or a 100% dividend payout ratio.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Records IDR 975 Billion Net Profit in 1Q25 (+10% YoY)
tickerNews.content: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya recorded a net profit of 975 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+10% YoY, +30% QoQ), in line with expectations as it equals 25% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~25%). Revenue grew to 32.7 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY, +9% QoQ), equivalent to 25% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~24%). Meanwhile, the operating profit margin remained relatively stable at 3.8% (vs. 1Q24: 3.9%, 4Q24: 3.2%), so operating profit grew to 1.3 trillion rupiah (+10% YoY, +30% QoQ), exceeding expectations as it equals 29% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~25%).

tickerNews.title: MAPI 1Q25 Same Store Sales Growth at +0.1% YoY, Driven by Active Segment
tickerNews.content: Mitra Adiperkasa recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +0.1% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: -1.1% YoY, 4Q24: +0% YoY). This result was supported by the 'active' segment under Map Aktif Adiperkasa (MAPA) which recorded SSSG of +2.9% YoY, and the 'retail/specialty stores' segment with SSSG of +0.1% YoY. Meanwhile, the 'cafe & restaurant' segment under Map Boga Adiperkasa (MAPB) recorded a decrease in SSSG of -9.4% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: -27.6% YoY, 4Q24: -15% YoY).

tickerNews.title: CNMA Cinema XXI Network Reached Record All-Time High with Over 14 Million Viewers in April 2025
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Nusantara Sejahtera Raya, Suryo Suherman, said that the Cinema XXI theater network recorded more than 14 million viewers during April 2025, marking the company's all-time high record. Previously, the highest monthly viewer count recorded by the company was 11.7 million viewers in June 2019. Suryo stated that this achievement was attained thanks to strong movie line-ups, both local and international.

tickerNews.title: TUGU to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend of ~IDR 280 Billion
tickerNews.content: Asuransi Tugu Pratama Indonesia will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of approximately 280 billion rupiah or approximately 78.8 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~40% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 7.6% as of Monday (5/5). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is May 8, 2025, while payment is on May 28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PWON Allocates IDR 2.48 Trillion Capex for 2025, Focusing on New Projects and Superblock Expansion
tickerNews.content: The Director and Corporate Secretary of Pakuwon Jati, Minarto Basuki, said that the company allocated a capex of 2.48 trillion rupiah during 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 2.71 trillion rupiah), with 59% of it designated for construction and the remainder for expansion. Minarto mentioned that PWON will start expanding existing superblocks - such as Kota Kasablanka, Gandaria City, Pakuwon Mall Bekasi, and Pakuwon City Mall Surabaya - which includes the addition of retail areas, residential, hotels, and offices. In addition, Minarto revealed that PWON will open 3 hotels during 2025.

tickerNews.title: ULTJ to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend of ~IDR 468 Billion
tickerNews.content: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of approximately 468 billion rupiah or 45 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~41% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 3.3% as of Monday (5/5). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is May 14, 2025, while payment is on June 5, 2025.
